intro: Lachnocaulon michauxii, commonly known as the Michaux's lachnocaulon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
